Detailed Description

Kernel ANSI C TPixelGroups functions, last updated 7/2/2002.

Works on TPixelGroups structure and keeps track of an array of TPixelGroup structures. These functions are part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.01
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)

Function Documentation

bool k_AddColorsToGroups (  const TImage *    pSource,
TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups
) 
 

After the creation of a TPixelGroups structure this function will get the original pixel colors from given source image and insert them into all the groups contained in TPixelGroups.

Parameters:
pSource  Image to get the original pixel values from. The PixelGroups positions must be derived from this image.
Returns :
False if the TPixelGroups structure contains no groups or one of the parameters is a NULL pointer.

Definition at line 143 of file kernel_pixelgroups.c.

void k_AddGroupToGroups (  const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups
) 
 

The pPixelGroup structure is added to pPixelGroups.

The function keeps track of allocation and updates the AllocatedPixelGroups member in TPixelGroups. Note: All memory allocated in the TPixelGroup structure is copied to a new structure, you must remember to free the memory in pPixelGroup.

Parameters:
pPixelGroup  PixelGroup to be added.

Referenced by k_DeriveBlobs(), and k_InsertGroupInGroups().

void k_AllocGroups (  TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups,
unsigned int    InitialSize
) 
 

Allocates memory for TPixelGroup structures.

All new TPixelGroup structures are initialised by calling k_InitPixelGroup(),

Parameters:
InitialSize  (unsigned int) Number of TPixelGroup structures to allocate memory for. Must be 1 or greater.

Definition at line 63 of file kernel_pixelgroups.c.

References TPixelGroups::AllocatedGroups, k_EmptyGroups(), k_InitGroup(), TPixelGroups::NumberOfGroups, and TPixelGroups::pGroups.

Referenced by k_DeriveBlobs().

void k_EmptyGroups (  TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups ) 
 

Deletes all allocated memory in TPixelGroups including all allocated memory for each TPixelGroup structure in the pGroups array.

Sets the other variables to 0. Always call this function when leaving a scope where a TPixelGroups variable were created and used.

Definition at line 49 of file kernel_pixelgroups.c.

References k_EmptyGroup(), k_InitGroups(), TPixelGroups::NumberOfGroups, and TPixelGroups::pGroups.

Referenced by k_AllocGroups(), and k_DeriveBlobs().

bool k_GetGroupWithPos (  const TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups,
unsigned int *    pGroupIndex,
T2DInt    Pos,
unsigned int *    pPosIndex
) 
 

Returns the index in which the given position were found.

Parameters:
pGroupIndex  The first group index in which the position Pos were found. Unchanged if position was not found.
Pos  Position to test for.
pPosIndex  If the position "pos" is found, the pPosIndex of the position is returned in this parameter, if NULL this parameter is not used. If not found, the parameter is unchanged.
Returns :
true if the position was found, false if not found or pPixelGroup is NULL.

void k_InitGroups (  TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups ) 
 

Sets all the pointers in pPixelGroups to NULL.

Always call this function when creating a variable of the TPixelGroups type

bool k_InsertGroupInGroups (  const TPixelGroup *    pPixelGroup,
unsigned int    Index,
TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups
) 
 

Insert "pPixelGroup" at given Index.

The ordering of the groups is preserved.

Parameters:
pPixelGroup  PixelGroup to be inserted.
Index  Index in the array of groups to insert at.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.

Definition at line 104 of file kernel_pixelgroups.c.

References k_AddFileAndLine, k_AddGroupToGroups(), k_EmptyString(), k_InitGroup(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroups::NumberOfGroups, TPixelGroup::NumberOfPixels, TPixelGroup::pColor, TPixelGroups::pGroups, TPixelGroup::pPos, and UINT32.

bool k_RemoveGroup (  TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups,
unsigned int    GroupIndex
) 
 

Remove a TPixelGroup from the TPixelGroups structure.

Done by moving the last group in the pGroups array contained in TPixelGroups to the index which is to be removed. All memory allocated for the group to be removed are freed. Note: When removing an element at index GroupIndex in a loop which runs through all indexes, remember to iterate at GroupIndex again. Otherwise you will miss a group!

Parameters:
GroupIndex  Index of group in TPixelGroups.
Returns :
False if GroupIndex is out of range or pPixelGroups is a null pointer

Definition at line 162 of file kernel_pixelgroups.c.

References k_AddFileAndLine, k_EmptyGroup(), k_EmptyString(), k_InitString(), k_ShowMessage(), TPixelGroups::NumberOfGroups, and TPixelGroups::pGroups.

bool k_RemoveGroupSlow (  TPixelGroups *    pPixelGroups,
unsigned int    GroupIndex
) 
 

Same as k_RemoveGroup, but the ordering of the groups is preserved.

This function is slower than k_RemoveGroup.

Parameters:
Index  Index in the array of groups to be removed.
Returns :
False, if Index is out of range.
